title: Newtons first law - suspending block with strings

content.question: A <math alttext="50 newton" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>50</mn><mtext> N</mtext></mstyle></math> block is suspended from the ceiling and wall by light strings as shown in the figure. String <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>A</mtext></math> is at an angle <math alttext="theta equals 30 degrees" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>θ</mi><mo>=</mo><msup><mn>30</mn><mo>∘</mo></msup></math> below the horizontal and String <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>B</mtext></math> is horizontal. The tension in String <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>B</mtext></math> is most nearly

choices.label: <math alttext="29 newtons" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>29</mn><mtext> N</mtext></mstyle></math>
<math alttext="50 newtons" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>50</mn><mtext> N</mtext></mstyle></math>
<math alttext="87 newtons" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>87</mn><mtext> N</mtext></mstyle></math>
<math alttext="100 newtons" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>100</mn><mtext> N</mtext></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="87 newtons" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>87</mn><mtext> N</mtext></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
